mobileControls.listeners: touchstart with preventDefault + click fallback on grid cells

gridInteraction.cellSelection: Tap cell to select, highlight across/down clue
gridInteraction.letterEntry: On-screen keyboard buttons (A-Z) with touchstart + click
gridInteraction.navigation: Auto-advance to next cell after letter entry
gridInteraction.backspace: Delete button to clear current cell and move back

responsiveDesign.mobile: Single column: grid above, clues below, keyboard at bottom
responsiveDesign.tablet: Two column: grid left, clues right, keyboard below grid
responsiveDesign.desktop: Same as tablet with larger cells

gameFeatures.validation: Check button highlights correct (green) vs incorrect (red) letters

uiComponents.clueDisplay: Current clue shown prominently above/beside grid
uiComponents.clueList: Scrollable across/down clue lists with tap-to-jump

notes: CRITICAL: Add touchstart listeners with preventDefault to ALL interactive elements (grid cells, keyboard buttons, control buttons)
CRITICAL: Include mobile on-screen keyboard - don't rely on device keyboard
Grid cells must be min 44px x 44px for touch accessibility
Use CSS touch-action: manipulation on all buttons
Implement tap-to-select cell, then tap keyboard letter to fill
Auto-advance cursor to next cell in current word after letter entry
Highlight current across/down word when cell selected
Store puzzle state in localStorage for persistence
Provide visual feedback for correct/incorrect on check
Clues should be authentic Pleasantville/Westchester references
Example clues: 'Village north of White Plains' (answer: PLEASANTVILLE too long, use abbrev), 'Metro-North line' (HARLEM), 'Saw Mill ___' (RIVER)
Keep answers 3-7 letters for 5x5 grid constraint
Test on mobile first - ensure keyboard doesn't obscure grid

userPrompt: create a mini crossword about the town of pleasantville and westchester more broadly, following best practices for crossword clue creation and modeled after the NYT mini crossword in design and functionality
